game

Class PokerRules

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.PokerRules

  • public class PokerRules
extends java.lang.Object

    Class that determines which player who has the best poker hand

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private HoleCards[] arrayWithHands
      An array where every element consist of the two unique cards that are given to each player.
      private Card[] cardsOnTable
      The cards that lie on the table.
      private Card[] highestCardStraight
      If a player gets a straight, the highest card that makes up that straight is saved in highestCardStraight.
      private int numberOfPlayers
      The number of players participating in the game.
      private HandRank tableCardRank
      The rank of the cards that are on the table.

    • Field Detail

      • tableCardRank

        private HandRank tableCardRank
        The rank of the cards that are on the table.

      • numberOfPlayers

        private int numberOfPlayers
        The number of players participating in the game.

      • cardsOnTable

        private Card[] cardsOnTable
        The cards that lie on the table.

      • arrayWithHands

        private HoleCards[] arrayWithHands
        An array where every element consist of the two unique cards that are given to each player.

      • highestCardStraight

        private Card[] highestCardStraight
        If a player gets a straight, the highest card that makes up that straight is saved in highestCardStraight. If the cards on the table makes up a straight, the highest card of that straight is saved at the last index in highestCardStraight.

    • Method Detail

      • determineHandRanking

        private HandRank determineHandRanking(Card[] fiveCards,
                                      int indexPlayer)
        Determines the highest possible rank of the five cards given as an input.
        Parameters:
        fiveCards - An array containing five cards.
        indexPlayer - The index of the player the five cards belongs to.
        Returns:
        The highest ranking of the five cards given as an input.

      • insertionSort

        private Card[] insertionSort(Card[] cards)
        Algorithm that sorts the rank of an arbitrary number of cards in ascending order.
        Parameters:
        cards - The unsorted cards.
        Returns:
        The cards sorted from the lowest to the highest rank.

      • makeSortedArray7cards

        private Card[] makeSortedArray7cards(HoleCards playersHand,
                                     Card[] cardsOnTable)
        Method that takes the card a player has in its hand and add those cards to an array together with the five cards on the table. This array is sorted from the card with the lowest to the highest rank.
        Parameters:
        playersHand - The hand of a player.
        cardsOnTable - The five cards that are on the table.
        Returns:
        The sorted array of seven cards.

      • decideHighestCard

        private int decideHighestCard(int indexPlayer1,
                              HoleCards h1,
                              int indexPlayer2,
                              HoleCards h2)
        Method that determines which one of two players who has the highest card, including the cards on the table.
        Parameters:
        indexPlayer1 - The index of the first player.
        h1 - The hand the first player has.
        indexPlayer2 - The index of the second player.
        h2 - The hand the second player has.
        Returns:
        The index of the player who has the highest card. If they both have the exact same rank of the cards -1 is returned.

      • decideBestPair

        private int decideBestPair(int indexPlayer1,
                           HoleCards h1,
                           int indexPlayer2,
                           HoleCards h2)
        Method that decides which of two players, who both have two pair, has the best hand. If both players have the same pair, the player with the highest of the three remaining cards will have the best hand.
        Parameters:
        indexPlayer1 - The index of the first player.
        h1 - The hand the first player has.
        indexPlayer2 - The index of the second player.
        h2 - The hand the second player has.
        Returns:
        The index of the player who has the best hand. If both hands have the exact same rank, -1 is returned.

      • decideBestTwoPair

        private int decideBestTwoPair(int indexPlayer1,
                              HoleCards h1,
                              int indexPlayer2,
                              HoleCards h2)
        Method that decides which of two players, who both have two pair, has the best hand. The player with the highest pair wins. If two players have the same two pair, then the fifth card kicker determines the winner.
        Parameters:
        indexPlayer1 - The index of the first player.
        h1 - The hand the first player has.
        indexPlayer2 - The index of the second player.
        h2 - The hand the second player has.
        Returns:
        The index of the player who has the best hand. If they both have the exact same rank of the cards -1 is returned.

      • decideBestThreeOfAKind

        private int decideBestThreeOfAKind(int indexPlayer1,
                                   HoleCards h1,
                                   int indexPlayer2,
                                   HoleCards h2)
        Method that decides which of two players, who both have three of a kind, has the best hand. The player with the highest ranked cards that makes up three of a kind wins. If two players have the same three of a kind, then the highest of the two remaining card kickers determines the winner.
        Parameters:
        indexPlayer1 - The index of the first player.
        h1 - The hand the first player has.
        indexPlayer2 - The index of the second player.
        h2 - The hand the second player has.
        Returns:
        The index of the player who has the best hand. If they both have the exact same rank of the cards -1 is returned.

      • decideBestStraight

        private int decideBestStraight(int indexPlayer1,
                               int indexPlayer2)
        Method that decides which of two players, who both have a straight, has the best hand. The player with the highest ranked card wins.
        Parameters:
        indexPlayer1 - The index of the first player.
        indexPlayer2 - The index of the second player.
        Returns:
        The index of the player who has the best hand. If they both have the exact same rank of the cards -1 is returned.

      • checkStraight

        private boolean checkStraight(Card[] fiveCards,
                              int indexPlayer)
        Method that checks if five cards make a straight. Also checking the special case with straight from ACE to FIVE.
        Parameters:
        fiveCards - The hand that may or may not make up a straight.
        Returns:
        A boolean that is true if the cards make a straight and is false otherwise.

      • checkFlush

        private boolean checkFlush(Card[] fiveCards)
        Method that checks if five cards make a flush.
        Parameters:
        fiveCards - The hand that may or may not make up a flush.
        Returns:
        A boolean that is true if the cards make a flush and is false otherwise.

        Parameters:
        fiveCards - The hand that may or may not have four of a kind.
        Returns:
        A boolean that is true if the cards have four of a kind and is false otherwise.

        Returns:
        A boolean that is true if the cards make up a full house and is false otherwise.

        private boolean checkTwoPair(Card[] fiveCards)
        Method that checks if there are two pairs among five cards.
        Parameters:
        fiveCards - The hand that may or may not contain two pairs.
        Returns:
